content.text:
[Verse 1]
     [ch]A[/ch]                       [ch]Bm[/ch]
Von Geburt an beginnt das Erlebnis,
      [ch]E[/ch]                  [ch]A[/ch]
Wenn wir uns zur Sonne drehn.
        [ch]F#m[/ch]                    [ch]Bm[/ch]
Es gibt mehr zu sehen, Als man je sehen kann,
         [ch]G[/ch]                         [ch]E[/ch]
Mehr zu tun,    Soviel mehr zu verstehn.
     [ch]A[/ch]                  [ch]Bm[/ch]
Das Leben hier ist ein Wunder,
       [ch]E[/ch]                     [ch]A[/ch]
Alles neu, alles endlos und weit.
         [ch]F#m[/ch]                      [ch]Bm[/ch]
Und die Sonne zieht leis,  Ihren goldenen Kreis,
                [ch]G[/ch]                   [ch]E[/ch]
Führt Groß und Klein,   In die Ewigkeit.

[Chorus]
                [ch]A[/ch]                        [ch]G[/ch]
Und im ewigen Kreis    Dreht sich unser Leben.
                  [ch]D[/ch]                 [ch]E[/ch]
Dem Gesetz der Natur,  Sind wir geweiht.
               [ch]A[/ch]    [ch]F#[/ch]          [ch]Bm[/ch]       [ch]C[/ch]
Wir sind alle Teil,    Dieses Universums.
         [ch]A[/ch]    [ch]E[/ch]                 [ch]D[/ch]        [ch]A[/ch]
Und das Leben      ein ewiger Kreis!


[Bridge]

[ch]A[/ch]  [ch]Bm[/ch]  [ch]E[/ch]  [ch]A[/ch]  [ch]F#m[/ch]  [ch]Bm[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]  [ch]E[/ch]

[Chorus]
                [ch]A[/ch]                        [ch]G[/ch]
Und im ewigen Kreis    Dreht sich unser Leben.
                  [ch]D[/ch]                 [ch]E[/ch]
Dem Gesetz der Natur,  Sind wir geweiht.
               [ch]A[/ch]    [ch]F#[/ch]          [ch]Bm[/ch]       [ch]C[/ch]
Wir sind alle Teil,    Dieses Universums.
         [ch]A[/ch]    [ch]E[/ch]                 [ch]D[/ch]        [ch]A[/ch]
Und das Leben      ein ewiger Kreis!

[Verse 1]
[ch]Am[/ch]              [ch]G[/ch]               [ch]C[/ch]
Dein Lächeln geht durch die Decke,
[ch]Am[/ch]              [ch]G[/ch]            [ch]C[/ch]
da gehen die Sterne für auf 
       [ch]Am[/ch]          [ch]G[/ch]             [ch]C[/ch]
und zeige ich Zeichen von Schwäche, 
[ch]C[/ch]                [ch]G[/ch]              [ch]C[/ch]
gleichst du das gleich wieder aus.


[ch]F[/ch]          [ch]Am[/ch]           [ch]C[/ch]          [ch]G[/ch]
In deine Richtung verneige ich mich,
         [ch]F[/ch]                      [ch]C[/ch]       [ch]G[/ch]
habe Dank für dein riesiges Herz.
         [ch]F[/ch]           [ch]Am[/ch]                      [ch]C[/ch]          [ch]G[/ch]
Aus allen Wolken fallen Worte für dich.
         [ch]F[/ch]                      [ch]C[/ch]       [ch]G[/ch]
Als wollten sie es, dass du es hörst.


[Chorus]
        [ch]C[/ch]                               [ch]G[/ch]
Dieses Lied ist für eine Seele von Mensch,
                             [ch]Dm[/ch]                                     [ch]F[/ch]
dafür das du so an mich denkst, dafür das du für mich blind kämpfst.
        [ch]C[/ch]                               [ch]G[/ch]
Dieses Lied ist für eine Seele von Mensch
                                     [ch]Dm[/ch] 
und vielleicht eine Art Kompliment,
  [ch]Am[/ch]                  [ch]F[/ch]              [ch]Dm[/ch] [ch]C[/ch]       [ch]F[/ch]       [ch]Am[/ch]         [ch]G[/ch]    [ch]C[/ch]
egal wie du es nennst und danke für jeden Moment. Du bist ein Geschenk.

Deine Offenheit zeichnet dich aus, 
          [ch]Am[/ch]    [ch]G[/ch]            [ch]C[/ch]
einer deiner leichtesten Künste 
            [ch]C[/ch]           [ch]G[/ch]               [ch]C[/ch]
ist aus Asche noch Burgen zu bauen.


[ch]F[/ch]          [ch]Am[/ch]           [ch]C[/ch]          [ch]G[/ch]

         [ch]F[/ch]                      [ch]C[/ch]       [ch]G[/ch]
habe Dank für deinen riesigen Mut,

egal wie du es nennst und danke für jeden Moment. Du bist ein Geschenk.

>Subject: Re: REQ: Chords to Dirty old town


{title:Dirty Old Town}
{subtitle:Ewan McColl}

I met my [E]love by the gasworks door;
Dreamed a [A]dream by the old ca[E]nal.
Kissed my [C#m]boy by the factory [E]wall.
Dirty old [F#m]town, [B7] dirty old [C#m]town.


The moon is shifting behind a cloud,
Cats are crawling all along the beat,
Springs a girl in the streets at night.
Dirty old town, dirty old town.

I heard a whistle coming from the docks
And a train set the night on fire,
Smelled the spring on a smoke-filled air.
Dirty old town, dirty old town.

I'm gonna get me a nice sharp axe,
Shining steel tempered in a fire,
Cut you down like an old dead tree,
Dirty old town, dirty old town.


--
                          ^  ^  ^
regards,         EXTRA   / \/ \/ \ NULLA
Ludwig          BAVARIAM \ /\ /\ / VITA

Did you learn to dream in the morning?
Abandon dreams in the afternoon?
Wait without hope in the evening?
        Did you stand there in the traces and let 'em feed you lies?
        Did you trail along behind them wearing blinkers on your eyes?
        Did you kiss the foot that kicked you, did you thank them for

        Did you ask for their forgiveness for the act of being born,
                act of being born, act of being born?

Did you alter the face of the city?
Make any change in the world you found?
Or did you observe all the warnings?
        Did you read the trespass notices, did you keep off the grass?
        Did you shuffle up the pavements just to let your betters pass?
        Did you learn to keep your mouth shut, were you seen but never heard?
        Did you learn to be obedient and jump to at a word,
                jump to at a word, jump to at a word?

Did you demand any answers?
The who and the what and the reason why?
Did you ever question the setup?
        Did you stand aside and let 'em choose while you took second best?

        Did you settle for the shoddy and did you think it right

What did you learn in the morning?
How much did you know in the afternoon?
Were you content in the evening?
        Did they teach you how to question when you were at the school?
        Did the factory help you, were you the maker or the tool?
        Did the place where you were living enrich your life and then
        Did you reach some understanding of all your fellow men,

[[ch]G[/ch]]My old man was a good old man
Skilled in the moulding [[ch]D[/ch]]trade

[[ch]C[/ch]]My old man was [[ch]D[/ch]]made
[[ch]C[/ch]]Down on his knees in the [[ch]G[/ch]]moulding sand

[Verse 1]
[ch]Am[/ch]             [ch]D[/ch]                   [ch]E7[/ch]        [ch]Am[/ch]
Out of the dirt and darkness I was born, go down!
[ch]Am[/ch]                      [ch]Em[/ch]            [ch]Am[/ch]       [ch]E7[/ch]
Out of the hard black coalface I was torn, go down!
[ch]C[/ch]
Kicked on the world and the earth split open
[ch]E7[/ch]                 [ch]Am[/ch]               [ch]G[/ch]        [ch]Am[/ch]
Crawled through a crack where the rock was broken
[ch]Dm[/ch]           [ch]Am[/ch]    [ch]Dm[/ch]        [ch]E7[/ch]        [ch]Am[/ch]
Burrowed a hole, away in the coal, go down!

[Verse 2]
[ch]Am[/ch]             [ch]D[/ch]                           [ch]E7[/ch]        [ch]Am[/ch]
In a cradle of coal in the darkness I was laid, go down!
[ch]Am[/ch]                      [ch]Em[/ch]            [ch]Am[/ch]       [ch]E7[/ch]
Down in the dirt and darkness I was raised, go down!
[ch]C[/ch]
Cut me teeth on a five-foot timber
[ch]E7[/ch]         [ch]Am[/ch]            [ch]G[/ch]        [ch]Am[/ch]
Held up the roof with my little finger
[ch]Dm[/ch]           [ch]Am[/ch]    [ch]Dm[/ch]        [ch]E7[/ch]        [ch]Am[/ch]
Started me time away in the mine, go down!

[Verse 3]
[ch]Am[/ch]                    [ch]D[/ch]                   [ch]E7[/ch]        [ch]Am[/ch]
On the day that I was born I was six feet tall, go down!
[ch]Am[/ch]                      [ch]Em[/ch]                 [ch]Am[/ch]       [ch]E7[/ch]
And the very next day I learned the way to haul, go down!
[ch]C[/ch]
On the third day worked at board and piller
[ch]E7[/ch]              [ch]Am[/ch]          [ch]G[/ch]        [ch]Am[/ch]
Worked on the fourth as a long-wall filler
[ch]Dm[/ch]           [ch]Am[/ch]       [ch]Dm[/ch]        [ch]E7[/ch]        [ch]Am[/ch]
Getting me steam up, hewing the seam, go down!

[Verse 4]
[ch]Am[/ch]                    [ch]D[/ch]                       [ch]E7[/ch]        [ch]Am[/ch]
I'm the son of the son of the son of a collier's son, go down!
[ch]Am[/ch]                      [ch]Em[/ch]                        [ch]Am[/ch]       [ch]E7[/ch]
Coal dust runs in the veins where the blood should run, go down!
[ch]C[/ch]
Five steel ribs and an iron backbone
[ch]E7[/ch]              [ch]Am[/ch]            [ch]G[/ch]        [ch]Am[/ch]
Teeth that can bite through rock and blackstone
[ch]Dm[/ch]           [ch]Am[/ch]       [ch]Dm[/ch]        [ch]E7[/ch]        [ch]Am[/ch]
Working me time, away in the mine, go down!

[Verse 5]
[ch]Am[/ch]                [ch]D[/ch]                       [ch]E7[/ch]        [ch]Am[/ch]
Three hundred years I hewed at the coal by hand, go down!
[ch]Am[/ch]                [ch]Em[/ch]                     [ch]Am[/ch]       [ch]E7[/ch]
In the pits of Durham and East Northumberland, go down!
[ch]C[/ch]
Been gassed and burned and blown asunder
[ch]E7[/ch]           [ch]Am[/ch]        [ch]G[/ch]        [ch]Am[/ch]
Buried more times than I can number
[ch]Dm[/ch]           [ch]Am[/ch]       [ch]Dm[/ch]        [ch]E7[/ch]        [ch]Am[/ch]
Getting the coal, away in the hole, go down!

[Verse 6]
[ch]Am[/ch]                    [ch]D[/ch]                                 [ch]E7[/ch]        [ch]Am[/ch]
I've scrabbled and picked at the face where the roof was low, go down!
[ch]Am[/ch]                [ch]Em[/ch]                        [ch]Am[/ch]       [ch]E7[/ch]
Crawled in the seams where only a mole could go, go down!
[ch]C[/ch]
In the thin-cut seams I've ripped and redded
[ch]E7[/ch]              [ch]Am[/ch]        [ch]G[/ch]        [ch]Am[/ch]
Where even the rats are born bow-legged
[ch]Dm[/ch]           [ch]Am[/ch]       [ch]Dm[/ch]        [ch]E7[/ch]        [ch]Am[/ch]
Winning the coal, away in the hole, go down!

[Verse 7]
[ch]Am[/ch]                    [ch]D[/ch]                              [ch]E7[/ch]        [ch]Am[/ch]

[ch]Am[/ch]                  [ch]Em[/ch]                             [ch]Am[/ch]       [ch]E7[/ch]

I've lain on me back in the old three-quarter
[ch]E7[/ch]         [ch]Am[/ch]        [ch]G[/ch]        [ch]Am[/ch]

[ch]Dm[/ch]           [ch]Am[/ch]    [ch]Dm[/ch]        [ch]E7[/ch]        [ch]Am[/ch]
Hewing the coal, away in the hole, go down!

[Verse 8]
[ch]Am[/ch]                    [ch]D[/ch]                       [ch]E7[/ch]        [ch]Am[/ch]
In the northern pits I've sweated and earned me pay, go down!
[ch]Am[/ch]                      [ch]Em[/ch]                   [ch]Am[/ch]       [ch]E7[/ch]

[ch]C[/ch]
Where the anthracite is hard and shining
[ch]E7[/ch]              [ch]Am[/ch]          [ch]G[/ch]        [ch]Am[/ch]

[ch]Dm[/ch]         [ch]Am[/ch]      [ch]Dm[/ch]        [ch]E7[/ch]        [ch]Am[/ch]

[Verse 9]
[ch]Am[/ch]                    [ch]D[/ch]             [ch]E7[/ch]        [ch]Am[/ch]
Out of the dirt and darkness I was born, go down!
[ch]Am[/ch]                      [ch]Em[/ch]             [ch]Am[/ch]       [ch]E7[/ch]

Lived in the shade of the high pit heap
[ch]E7[/ch]              [ch]Am[/ch]            [ch]G[/ch]        [ch]Am[/ch]

[ch]Dm[/ch]        [ch]Am[/ch]       [ch]Dm[/ch]        [ch]E7[/ch]        [ch]Am[/ch]

Ewan MacColl - The Father's Song

NB These chords work well with the original Ewan MacColl
version, but may not fit so well with the cover versions
that Dick Gaughan and others have done. Unfortunately I
can't find an online version of the original, and to
complicate things, some of the versions labelled "Ewan
MacColl" on youtube are actually the Gaughan version.


[ch]Dm[/ch]                          [ch]F[/ch]    [ch]A7[/ch]         [ch]Dm[/ch]
That's another day gone by, son, close your eyes
        [ch]F[/ch]               [ch]Cmaj7[/ch]             [ch]A7[/ch]
Now the moon is chasing clouds across the sky
      [ch]C[/ch]                 [ch]A7[/ch]
Go to sleep and have no fear, son
         [ch]F[/ch]       [ch]A7[/ch]      [ch]Dm[/ch]
For your mam and dad are near, son
        [ch]C[/ch]        [ch]Dm[/ch]     [ch]A7[/ch]            [ch]Dm[/ch]
And the giant is just a shadow on the wall


Go to sleep, and when you wake it will be light
There's no need to fear the darkness of the night
It's not like the dark you find, son
In the depth of some men's minds, son
That defies the daily coming of the dawn

Lie easy in your bed and grow up strong
You'll be needing all your strength before too long
For you'll soon be on your way, son
Fighting battles every day, son
With an enemy who thinks he owns the world

Stop your crying now, let daddy dry your tears
There's no bogey man to get you, never fear
There's no ogres, wicked witches
Only greedy sons of bitches
Who are waiting to exploit your life away

Don't you let 'em buy you out or break your pride
Don't you let yourself be used then cast aside
If you listen to their lying
They will con you into dying
You won't even know that you were once alive

No more talking now, it's time to go to sleep
There are answers to your questions but they'll keep
Go on asking while you grow, son
Go on asking till you know, son
And then send the answers ringing through the world

I think these chords work as accompaniment for Ewan McColl's original acapella version of this beautiful
song.  I originally worked the chords in B flat minor for the keyboard but found them too difficult to play
on the guitar, but played in A minor with capo on the 1st fret replicates the original key.

Ewan McColl's original acapella version can be found on YouTube ~ https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O9Qv5dBHElg

#002
{title:The First Time}
{st:Ewan MacColl}
The f[D]irst t[A]ime ever I s[D]aw your face,
I thought the s[G]un rose in you[D]r ey[A7]es.
And the moon and the s[G]tars were the g[D]ifts you gave
To the n[C]ight and the empty s[D]ky, my love.
To the n[C]ight and the empty s[D]ky.

The first time ever I kissed your mouth,
I felt the earth move in my hand,
Like the trembling heart of a captive bird,
That was there at my command, my love.
That was there at my command.

The first time ever I held you near,
I felt the heart beat close to mine.
I thought our joy would fill the world,
And would last 'till the end of time, my love.
And would last 'till the end of time.
#

#019
{title:The Springhill Disaster}
{st:Ewan MacColl & Peggy Seeger}
[Am]In the town of [G]Springhill, [Am]Nova [G]Scotia,
[Am]Down in the dark of the [C]Cumberland [Am]mine,
[Am]There's blood on the [C]coal and the [G]miners [Em]lie
[Am]In the roads that [G]never saw [Am]sun nor [G]sky,
[Am]Roads that [G]never saw [Am]sun nor [E7]sky.

In the town of Springhill you don't sleep easy,
Often the Earth will tremble and roll;
When the Earth is restless, miners die;
Bone and blood is the price of coal,
Bone and blood is the price of coal.

In the town of Springhill, Nova Scotia,
Late in the year of '58,
Day still comes and the Sun still shines,
But it's dark as the grave in the Cumberland mine,
Dark as the grave in the Cumberland mine.

Down at the coal-face, miners working,
Rattle of the belt and the cutter's blade;
Rumble of rock, and the walls close 'round:
The living and the dead men two miles down,
Living and the dead men two miles down.

Twelve men lay two miles from the pit-shaft;
Twelve men lay in the dark and sang.
Long hot days in the miners tomb:
It was three feet high and a hundred long,
Three feet high and a hundred long.

Three days passed and the lamps gave out,
And Kaehler Brushen, he up and said,
"There's no more water, nor light, nor bread,
So we'll live on songs and hope instead,
Live on songs and hope instead."

Listen for the shouts of the bare-faced miners,
Listen through the rubble for a rescue team;
Six hundred feet of coal and slag--
Hope imprisoned in a three foot seam,
Hope imprisoned in a three foot seam.

Eight days passed and some were rescued,
Leaving the dead to lie alone--
Through all their lives they dug a grave:
Two miles of earth for a marking stone,
Two miles of earth for a marking stone.
#
# Submitted to the ftp.nevada.edu:/pub/guitar archives
# by Steve Putz <putz@parc.xerox.com>
# 7 September 1992

This is an incredible song by Ewan Mcoll, made famous by the Dubliners with Luke Kelly
It is an incredible, powerful song and I couldnt believe no one had tabbed it before.
I normally play it with a mixture of picking and strumming and you may well want to do
same. You may also want to repeat bits and leave out chords to adapt it to the way you
it. There are so many versions of this song, and every one is different so everyone 
it differently.
In the second line of the verse you may want to leave out the G chord, and you might
to use C instead of Am.
Enjoy!

[[ch]C[/ch]]The old ways are changing you [[ch]F[/ch]] cannot deny
[[ch]C[/ch]]The day of the traveler's [[ch]F[/ch]]ov[[ch]G[/ch]]er
There's[[ch]Am[/ch]] nowhere to gang and there's [[ch]C[/ch]] nowhere to[[ch]F[/ch]] bide
So[[ch]C[/ch]] farewell to the life of the[[ch]F[/ch]] rov[[ch]C[/ch]]er

[[ch]C[/ch]]Goodbye to the tent and the [[ch]F[/ch]] old cara [[ch]G[/ch]] van
To[[ch]Am[/ch]] the tinker, the[[ch]C[/ch]] gypsy, the[[ch]F[/ch]] traveling [[ch]G[/ch]]man
And[[ch]G[/ch]] goodbye tae the[[ch]C[/ch]] thirty foot[[ch]F[/ch]] trail[[ch]F[/ch]]er

Farewell tae the cant and the traveling tongue
Farewell tae the Romany talking
The buying, the selling, the old fortune telling
The knock on the door and the hawking

You got to move fast to keep up with the times
For these days a man cannot dander
There's a bylaw to say you maun be on your way
And another to say ye can't wander

Farewell to the blossom and besoms of broom
Farewell tae the creels and the baskets
The folk of today would far rather pay
For a thing that is made oot o plastic

The old ways are passing and soon will be gone
And progress is aye a big factor
Its sent to afflict us and when they evict us
They tow us away wi a tractor

Farewell tae the pony, the cob, and the mare
The reins and the harness are idle
You don't need a strap when you're breaking up scrap
So farewell tae the bit and the bridle

Farewell tae the fields where we've sweated and toiled
At pulling and hauling and lifting
They'll soon have machines and the traveling queens
And their menfolk had better be shifting

        [ch]A[/ch]                       [ch]E[/ch]
No more watching the race from afar
     [ch]A[/ch]                     [ch]E[/ch]             [ch]A[/ch]
With steel-toe boots and a coarse boiler-suit
  [ch]E[/ch]                       [ch]B[/ch]
A lad amidst the furnaces scars

[Verse]
  [ch]E[/ch]                       [ch]A[/ch]            [ch]E[/ch]
I learned my trade, how I listened and watched
            [ch]A[/ch]                [ch]E[/ch]
I worked as hard as hard can be
         [ch]A[/ch]                    [ch]E[/ch]          [ch]A[/ch]
But with passing years I grew proud with hope
     [ch]E[/ch]                        [ch]B[/ch]
Of a future that was never to be

[Verse]
[ch]E[/ch]                      [ch]A[/ch]             [ch]E[/ch]
Late in the day as the Autumn turned pale
         [ch]A[/ch]                        [ch]E[/ch]
A figure watched us work from the door
     [ch]A[/ch]               [ch]E[/ch]           [ch]A[/ch]
Into burning air his words spoke clear
     [ch]E[/ch]                     [ch]B[/ch]
In a haze our jobs were no more

[Verse]
   [ch]E[/ch]                       [ch]A[/ch]              [ch]E[/ch]
I awoke each morning, days stretched into nights
      [ch]A[/ch]                           [ch]E[/ch]
And I lurched through a hollow routine
       [ch]A[/ch]                     [ch]E[/ch]              [ch]A[/ch]
In the queues each week with companions I'd stand
        [ch]E[/ch]                          [ch]B[/ch]
But our fortunes had turned on our dreams

[Verse]
        [ch]E[/ch]                      [ch]A[/ch]         [ch]E[/ch]
For two sons and a daughter we had to provide
   [ch]A[/ch]                         [ch]E[/ch]
My wife worked long into the nights
     [ch]A[/ch]                       [ch]E[/ch]              [ch]A[/ch]
To escape the stale air of a room with four walls
          [ch]E[/ch]                         [ch]B[/ch]
I skimmed stones at the quarry till light

[Verse]
       [ch]E[/ch]                          [ch]A[/ch]             [ch]E[/ch]
In the years that followed things picked up and shone
      [ch]A[/ch]                     [ch]E[/ch]
And I hustled a job where I could
   [ch]A[/ch]                            [ch]E[/ch]           [ch]A[/ch]
Re-skilled and re-tooled with a home of our own
     [ch]E[/ch]                              [ch]B[/ch]
In a strange shifting world we were stood

[Verse]
   [ch]E[/ch]                [ch]A[/ch]             [ch]E[/ch]
As time wore on our children grew tall
      [ch]A[/ch]                        [ch]E[/ch]
And I taught them all that I'd learned
       [ch]A[/ch]                   [ch]E[/ch]             [ch]A[/ch]
In and out of trouble, the same as their dad
        [ch]E[/ch]                              [ch]B[/ch]
Dodging cops, running streets at Pikes turn

[Verse]
   [ch]E[/ch]                         [ch]A[/ch]              [ch]E[/ch]
As some strangers say, we've carved our own way
     [ch]A[/ch]                          [ch]E[/ch]
In a world that still lists and turns
          [ch]A[/ch]                            [ch]E[/ch]             [ch]A[/ch]
But once again there's no work for the young in this town
        [ch]E[/ch]                             [ch]B[/ch]
And the queues form in air that still burns

[Verse]
         [ch]E[/ch]                       [ch]A[/ch]             [ch]E[/ch]
With the dusk tales said, as the evening light ebbs
       [ch]A[/ch]                  [ch]E[/ch]
My son walks off into the night
          [ch]A[/ch]                          [ch]E[/ch]              [ch]A[/ch]
With only dull flapping wings of the last bird that sings
         [ch]E[/ch]                         [ch]B[/ch]
He skims stones at the quarry till light

name: Yorkshire Regiment
tuning: E A D G B E

content.text:
[Intro]
[ch]C[/ch]   [ch]F[/ch]  [ch]C[/ch]  [ch]F[/ch]  [ch]C[/ch] [ch]G/B[/ch] [ch]Am[/ch]
[ch]C[/ch]   [ch]F[/ch]  [ch]C[/ch]

[Verse]
                    [ch]G[/ch]         [ch]F[/ch]        [ch]C[/ch]
You say you saw the Yorkshire Regiment
     [ch]F[/ch]               [ch]C[/ch]
Go parading down our street
       [ch]F[/ch]                      [ch]C[/ch]           [ch]Am[/ch]
How it breaks my heart, those brave young lads
                     [ch]G[/ch]       [ch]F[/ch]
Marching off to that crooked beat
         [ch]C[/ch]           [ch]G[/ch]       [ch]C[/ch]
Marching off to that crooked beat

[Verse]
                  [ch]G[/ch]               [ch]F[/ch]           [ch]C[/ch]
Here we wait each morning, to the drumming we drill
       [ch]F[/ch]                        [ch]C[/ch]
As our sergeant he barks and he bays
        [ch]F[/ch]                          [ch]C[/ch]        [ch]Am[/ch]
Oh, the jokes of the boys keep our spirits alive
           [ch]G[/ch]           [ch]F[/ch]
I miss you more than I say
  [ch]C[/ch]        [ch]G[/ch]           [ch]C[/ch]
I miss you more than I say

[Verse]
                  [ch]G[/ch]            [ch]F[/ch]          [ch]C[/ch]
The hot air hangs heavy on the village by day
       [ch]F[/ch]                            [ch]C[/ch]
In the fields where the poppies are grown
          [ch]F[/ch]                       [ch]C[/ch]           [ch]Am[/ch]
Where our bomb struck here, was a market last year
                 [ch]G[/ch]             [ch]F[/ch]
Now the children greet us with stones
    [ch]C[/ch]        [ch]G[/ch]             [ch]C[/ch]        [ch]F[/ch]  [ch]C[/ch]
The children greet us with stones

[Verse]
                  [ch]G[/ch]          [ch]F[/ch]              [ch]C[/ch]
And it's funny to think as I write you this note
      [ch]F[/ch]                   [ch]C[/ch]
And I turn my head to the sky
         [ch]F[/ch]                       [ch]C[/ch]         [ch]Am[/ch]
The same stars that burn on this desert at night
            [ch]G[/ch]              [ch]F[/ch]
Are shining down where you lie
    [ch]C[/ch]       [ch]G[/ch]              [ch]C[/ch]
Are shining down where you lie

[Instrumental]
[ch]C[/ch]   [ch]F[/ch]  [ch]C[/ch]  [ch]F[/ch]  [ch]C[/ch] [ch]G/B[/ch] [ch]Am[/ch]
[ch]C[/ch]   [ch]F[/ch]  [ch]C[/ch]

[Verse]
              [ch]G[/ch]       [ch]F[/ch]             [ch]C[/ch]
We lost young Private Mitchell last week
    [ch]F[/ch]                  [ch]C[/ch]
His funeral was just today
           [ch]F[/ch]                     [ch]C[/ch]      [ch]Am[/ch]
And as the sandstorm stung our saluting hands
         [ch]G[/ch]       [ch]F[/ch]
His body lifted away
          [ch]C[/ch]        [ch]G[/ch]       [ch]C[/ch]
His young body was lifted away

[Verse]
                 [ch]G[/ch]            [ch]F[/ch]          [ch]C[/ch]
And as the bugle tune stopped playing it
       [ch]F[/ch]                    [ch]C[/ch]
On the wind it was carried away
    [ch]F[/ch]                 [ch]C[/ch]    [ch]Am[/ch]
Our Sergeant Brown he told us
                [ch]G[/ch]        [ch]F[/ch]
He died for his nation's sake
   [ch]C[/ch]            [ch]G[/ch]        [ch]C[/ch]     [ch]F[/ch]  [ch]C[/ch]   [ch]F[/ch]  [ch]C[/ch]
He died for his nation's sake

[Verse]
            [ch]G[/ch]       [ch]F[/ch]         [ch]C[/ch]
But my mind started wandering later
        [ch]F[/ch]                    [ch]C[/ch]
To some thoughts so cold and grey
      [ch]F[/ch]                      [ch]C[/ch]   [ch]Am[/ch]
Do we give our lives for our country
                           [ch]G[/ch]       [ch]F[/ch]
Or by our leaders are they stolen away?
          [ch]C[/ch]                [ch]G[/ch]       [ch]C[/ch]
Or by our leaders are they stolen away?

[Verse]
               [ch]G[/ch]           [ch]F[/ch]          [ch]C[/ch]
And as I look around at us young lads
        [ch]F[/ch]                 [ch]C[/ch]
Smiling bravely in our uniforms
         [ch]F[/ch]                    [ch]C[/ch]     [ch]Am[/ch]
I wonder when I found I first liked them
                  [ch]G[/ch]          [ch]F[/ch]
Sons of those who wanted the war
        [ch]C[/ch]         [ch]G[/ch]          [ch]C[/ch]
Sons of those who wanted the war

[Verse]
           [ch]G[/ch]              [ch]F[/ch]       [ch]C[/ch]
So come ye squaddies from Banfrie Chapel
     [ch]F[/ch]                          [ch]C[/ch]
From Leeds and the towns to the north
    [ch]F[/ch]                         [ch]C[/ch]   [ch]Am[/ch]
The troop is our lives to our leaders
                 [ch]G[/ch]        [ch]F[/ch]
Hard luck, not a grain of sorrow
     [ch]C[/ch]           [ch]G[/ch]             [ch]C[/ch]
Hard luck, not a damn grain of sorrow

[Instrumental]
[ch]C[/ch]   [ch]F[/ch]  [ch]C[/ch]  [ch]F[/ch]  [ch]C[/ch] [ch]G/B[/ch] [ch]Am[/ch]
[ch]C[/ch]   [ch]F[/ch]  [ch]C[/ch]

[Verse]
                    [ch]G[/ch]         [ch]F[/ch]        [ch]C[/ch]
You say you saw the Yorkshire Regiment
     [ch]F[/ch]               [ch]C[/ch]
Go parading down our street
       [ch]F[/ch]                      [ch]C[/ch]           [ch]Am[/ch]
How it breaks my heart, those brave young lads
                     [ch]G[/ch]       [ch]F[/ch]
Marching off to that crooked beat
         [ch]C[/ch]           [ch]G[/ch]       [ch]C[/ch]
Marching off to that crooked beat
